bibl.title: Letter from John H. Andrus to John J. Moran, August 16, 1937

div1.p: Andrus asks Moran for his address. This letter was sent via the Veterans' Bureau.

div1.head: Letter from John H. Andrus to John J. Moran, August 16, 1937
div1.opener:
J.H. Andrus
805 Cooper St.
Camden, N. J.
8-16137
Captain John J. Moran
Dear Captain:
div1.p: You probably do not remember me.

As a private, Hospital Corps, was detailed
in the laboratory and mosquito farm of the
Major Walter Reed Commission until I volun-
teered for innoculation.

Tried to get your address from Veterans
Bureau. They agreed to forward a letter.

As I am not certain you will get this it is
simply to ask that you send me your address.
With kindest regards and best wishes,
